summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney discussing a conversation with Florida Bar Ethics Counsel regarding victim notification obligations in the Epstein matter. The Bar indicated it would issue a 'non-opinion' and that solicitation rules do not apply. The email also references awaiting a response from other parties and inquires about the resolution of the 'Doe v. United States' case.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.context: Recipient of the email, referenced by his title 'USAFLS', indicating he is the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida involved in the Epstein matter.

persons.name: Katherine W. Ezell
persons.context: Primary recipient of the email, likely a colleague or legal professional involved in the Epstein case communications.

persons.name: Mr. Josefsberg
persons.context: An individual who made a related inquiry to the Florida Bar; the email author is awaiting his or Ms. Ezell's response regarding the Bar's reply.

persons.name: Dexter
persons.context: Addressed in the email regarding an inquiry about the 'Doe v. United States' case; likely a colleague such as another attorney.

persons.name: Mr. Edwards
persons.context: Referenced in relation to the resolution of the 'Doe v. United States' case; Dexter is asked if he has heard from him.

connections.description: Both are recipients/colleagues in the email chain discussing legal ethics and victim notification in the Epstein case.
Both are involved in inquiries to the Florida Bar regarding the Epstein matter; the email author awaits their response.
Dexter is asked if he has heard from Mr. Edwards regarding the 'Doe v. United States' case, indicating a professional connection.

events.title: Conversation with Florida Bar Ethics Counsel
events.description: The email author spoke with someone from the Florida Bar regarding victim notification obligations under federal law in the Epstein matter. The Bar indicated it would issue a written 'non-opinion' by the end of the week.

events.title: Pending Florida Bar written opinion
events.description: The Florida Bar is expected to issue a written opinion by the end of the week, which will be a 'non-opinion' stating it cannot advise on federal victim notification obligations.

events.title: Inquiry about Doe v. United States resolution
events.description: The email asks Dexter if he has heard from Mr. Edwards regarding the resolution of the 'Doe v. United States' case, indicating an ongoing related legal matter.

keyFacts: The Florida Bar Ethics Counsel indicated it would issue a 'non-opinion' regarding victim notification obligations under federal law in the Epstein matter, stating it cannot advise on the issue.
The Bar confirmed that solicitation rules do not apply to the U.S. Attorney's Office in this context because they are not soliciting employment from victims.
The email references a related inquiry made by Mr. Josefsberg to the Florida Bar, but the Bar would not provide information due to confidentiality rules.
There is mention of the 'Doe v. United States' case, with an inquiry about its resolution, suggesting a connected legal proceeding.
